crypto.name: Rumours Say Aliens
crypto.desc:
In 1977, we sent over a golden disk out into space on the Voyager. Well, we now got something back, but the aliens used an encryption method that dates back to 1977 as well, with their own extraterrestrial twist.

created by jp_var03

crypto.name: XORry
crypto.desc:
Oops. I accidentally put my flag into this program and it spit out some garbage. Please get my flag back!

created by jp_var03

crypto.name: bashed
crypto.desc:
I was supposed to give you a free flag, but I started to bash my head on the keyboard as I was falling asleep and a bunch of garbage came out. Can you fix it?

Encoded flag: ygxgu{yZi3ob_y4hS3w_gs3_hFiu3xv!_32pqyu}

crypto.name: rapid fire ciphers
crypto.desc:
Here's a string of text that I found lying on the floor, can you help me decode it? Apparently it has 5 layers or something... here you go: NzE2NTY5NjQ2RTYzNjY3QTZBNjI=

created by aiden park

crypto.name: rsa brute
crypto.desc:
RSA is notoriously hard to bruteforce. So here's an easier challenge for you. Do you have what it takes? Give me the decrypted version of the ciphertext, appended by the private key d.

created by aiden park

crypto.name: veni vidi vici
crypto.desc:
Time for a history lesson. Some say one of the earliest forms of encryption was devised by a certain Roman emperor

created by jp_var03

forensic.name: cryptid calling
forensic.desc:
I was walking around at night, and i saw the cryptid the infamous Bergen Tech Highway Horse! It wrote down something on a piece of paper. It told me it wrote in "horse code", but I don't understand it. Can you?

created by jp_var03

forensic.name: fog.
forensic.desc:
THE FOG IS COMING. THE FOG IS COMING. OPEN YOUR EARS AND OPEN YOUR EYES.

created by jp_var03

forensic.name: no end in sight
forensic.desc:
There seems to be a lot of nested zip files here, and I gave up trying to do it by hand. Are you up for the challenge?

created by aiden park

forensic.name: password cracking 1
forensic.desc:
Try cracking the password protected file.

created by lilninja123

forensic.name: password cracking 2
forensic.desc:
Try cracking the password protected file. This same individual has the password 'g@mingSuperStars'.

created by lilninja123

forensic.name: scrambled
forensic.desc:
I had an egg, but it got scrambled by my dog, who left some magic bites... can you unscramble this egg???

created by jp_var03

forensic.name: stegosaurus
forensic.desc:
I was able to photograph a famous cryptid known as Mokele Mbembe! Rumours say it is a stegosaurus, but to me it looks a bit off. Perhaps it could be hiding somehting?

created by jp_var03

misc.name: osint 1 going outside
misc.desc: I decided to take a hike after all this stress going on. Find out what park I was in. Wrap your answer in btctf{}. Answer in all lowercase, with underscores replacing spaces

misc.name: osint 2 food

pwn.name: string cheese
pwn.desc:
I was using this program to buy string cheese. I think theres a flag. Can you "cheese" a solve?

created by jp_var03

rev.name: bad programming
rev.desc:
i was given an assignment to code a flag, but i think my horrible coding skills might have messed it up... a lot.

created by jp_var03

rev.name: compiler
rev.desc:
It's time to cut all the coding languages and go straight to assembly. What would flag(0x5b) return in this code? Be the compiler. LEAVE THE ANSWER IN HEX WITH 0x AND PLEASE WRAP THE ANSWER IN btctf{}

created by jp_var03

rev.name: crackme
rev.desc:
Ran out of ideas. Crack program. Get flag.

created by jp_var03

rev.name: go
rev.desc: golang is becoming popular in malware development. Using your reverse engineering skills to get the flag!

rev.name: golang
rev.desc: I followed a gopher down a tunnel and it left a binary. Analyze it and get the flag.

rev.name: snake byte
rev.desc:
I was coding up an easy challenge that would give you the flag automatically, but python was so slow that when I went back after compiling, it not only ate up my memory but my code too! Please help.

created by jp_var03
